prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Alderman Kyubi was murdered with a spear that had been on the wall.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: The fingerprints of the defendant, Damian Tenma, were found on the murder weapon.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, Alderman Kyubi was asleep from a drug he unwittingly ingested.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mayor Tenma attacked his helpless victim, impaling him like a human shish kebob!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: But the sudden pain jolted the victim awake, and he grabbed a statue and struck back!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through the testimonies and the evidences to see where there's a conflict.

First, looking at the testimonies from Fulbright. Testimony 4 says that Mayor Tenma killed the alderman after planting feathers and tracks. The evidence related to the crime scene includes the Crime Photo (Evidence 9), which mentions black feathers scattered on the blood. Also, the Yokai Legend Scroll (Evidence 1) talks about Tenma Taro having black feathers. So if the mayor planted the feathers to frame a yokai, but according to the scroll, Tenma Taro is depicted with black feathers, maybe that connects.

Wait, but Testimony 4 claims the mayor planted the feathers. But let's check the evidence. The Crime Photo (Evidence 9) shows black feathers at the scene. If the mayor planted them, but the Autopsy Report (Evidence 14) says the victim was stabbed with a spear and was in a drug-induced slumber. The mayor was found unconscious, so how could he have done that if he was knocked out? Maybe the murder weapon is another point. The Fox and Demon Statue (Evidence 7) was the weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. But the autopsy says Kyubi was stabbed. So the statue was used on the mayor, not the alderman. The alderman was killed by a spear. So Testimony 4 says the mayor killed the alderman, but the autopsy says the alderman was stabbed. If the mayor was bludgeoned and unconscious, how could he stab someone? That might be a contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 4 says Mayor Tenma killed the sleeping alderman after planting the feathers. But according to the Autopsy Report (Evidence 14), the alderman was stabbed around 3:20 PM and was in a drug-induced slumber. The mayor was found unconscious at the crime scene, possibly bludgeoned with the statue (Evidence 7). If the mayor was unconscious, he couldn't have stabbed Kyubi. So maybe Testimony 4 is contradicted by the Autopsy Report. But the testimony says the mayor killed the alderman, but the autopsy says the cause was stabbing. If the mayor was already unconscious, that's a contradiction.

Alternatively, looking at the Blackmail Letter (Evidence 15), which was found in Kyubi's pocket, and it's suggested L'Belle took it from the mayor's briefcase. That might tie into someone else's motive.

Wait, the testimony claims Mayor Tenma did the killing, but the Forbidden Chamber Key (Evidence 17) was swallowed by the mayor, which he took from the killer. If the mayor was the killer, he wouldn't have taken the key from himself. So that would contradict Testimony 4. Because if the key was swallowed by the mayor, and it was taken from the killer, then the killer can't be the mayor. Therefore, Evidence 17 (Forbidden Chamber Key) contradicts Testimony 4. Because the key was taken from the killer by the mayor, implying the killer is someone else. So if Testimony 4 says the mayor is the killer, but the key was taken from the killer (which would be himself), that's impossible. So Evidence 17 contradicts Testimony 4.

Yes, that seems right. The key was swallowed by the mayor after taking it from the killer. If the mayor was the killer, he couldn't have taken the key from himself. Therefore, the key evidence (17) contradicts Fulbright's Testimony 4.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. The user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They want one pair. Let me look through the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll list out the testimonies from Filch. He has four testimonies (0 to 3). prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It's true, I was watching a pro wrestling match on the office TV.
Person: Filch
Testimony 1
Testimony: My eyes mighta been slacking off, but my ears? They were working overtime.
Person: Filch
Testimony 2
Testimony: The floor there's all creaky squeaky-like. No way I woulda missed someone walking by.
Person: Filch
Testimony 3
Testimony: If Tenma Taro was to pass by, his staff woulda gone jingle jangle.
Person: Filch
Testimony 4
Testimony: So ya see, there weren't no Tenma Taro in the foyer.
Person: Filch

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by looking through the testimonies and see if any of them conflict with the evidence provided.

First, the testimonies are all from Filch (Testimonies 0-4). He claims he was watching a pro wrestling match on the office TV (Testimony 0). Then he says his ears were working overtime even if his eyes weren't (Testimony 1). He mentions the creaky floor in the foyer, so he would have heard someone passing by (Testimony 2). Then he says if Tenma Taro passed by, his staff would jingle jangle, implying he didn't hear that (Testimony 3). And concludes that Tenma Taro wasn't in the foyer (Testimony 4).

Looking at the evidence, let's check each one. Evidence 13 is the TV Listings, which shows that the wrestling match at 3 PM was circled. But the autopsy report (Evidence 14) says time of death around 3:20 PM. So Filch was watching the match during the time of the murder. But maybe there's something else.

Wait, the Crime Scene Diagram (Evidence 5) and Foyer Diagram (Evidence 6) might relate to the layout. The Fox and Demon Statue (Evidence 7) was the weapon, but no fingerprints. The Blackmail Letter (Evidence 15) might tie to L'Belle. The Hand Cream (Evidence 19) with L'Belle's logo could indicate he was there.

But focusing on Filch's testimonies about hearing. He says the floor is creaky, so he would hear anyone. But Jinxie's Statement (Evidence 12) says the demon fled toward the foyer. If Tenma Taro (the demon) went to the foyer, Filch should have heard either footsteps or the staff jingling. However, Filch claims he didn't hear Tenma Taro's staff (Testimony 3), hence no Tenma Taro in the foyer (Testimony 4). 

But according to the Yokai Legend Scroll (Evidence 1), Tenma Taro is depicted without a weapon. The scroll says Tenma Taro does not wield any weapon. So if Tenma Taro doesn't have a staff, then Filch's Testimony 3 about the staff jingling is incorrect. Because Filch assumes Tenma Taro has a staff, but according to the scroll, he doesn't. Therefore, Filch's reasoning that he didn't hear the staff jingle is based on a false premise. This would mean that Tenma Taro could have passed through without making the jingle, contradicting Filch's testimony. 

So the contradiction is between Evidence 1 (Yokai Legend Scroll) which states Tenma Taro doesn't have a staff, and Testimony 3 where Filch says the staff would jingle. Therefore, Filch's testimony is based on an incorrect assumption about Tenma Taro having a staff, which the evidence proves wrong.
